Ribuan Jabatan Eselon III dan IV DKI Terancam Dihapus
04 Nov 2019, 11:07 by Mosita Dwi Septiasputri


Ribuan Jabatan Eselon III dan IV DKI Terancam Dihapus

KBRN, Jakarta : Wacana Presiden Joko Widodo untuk merampingkan birokrasi di pemerintah pusat hingga daerah diprediksi akan berdampak dihapusnya 5.340 jabatan eselon III dan IV di lingkup Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta.Hal itu, kata Kepala Badan Kepegawaian Daerah (BKD) DKI Jakarta Chaidir, akan berpengaruh pada tunjangan kinerja daerah (TKD) para pejabat tersebut harus dikaji lagi."Meski ada perubahan posisi dari struktural ke fungsional, tapi mereka tetap mendapat tunjangan kinerja. Tapi itu masih harus dikaji lebih lanjut," kata Chaidir seperti dilansir Antara, Senin (4/11/2019).Saat ini total pejabat yang mengisi jabatan eselon III di DKI Jakarta mencapai 862 orang. Sedangkan eselon IV mencapai 4.478 orang atau totalnya ada 5.340 pejabat eselon III dan IV di DKI Jakarta.Untuk eselon III terdiri atas kepala bagian, kepala bidang dan camat. Sedangkan eselon IV terdiri atas kepala seksi, kepala sub bagian, kepala sub bidang, kepala unit pelaksana teknis (UPT) dan lurah.Chaidir menjelaskan, berpengaruhnya TKD adalah karena perampingan struktural di pemerintah daerah tentunya akan berimplikasi pada APBD DKI Jakarta yang menjadi sumber keuangan tunjangan tersebut.Kendati demikian, Chaidir menjelaskan, pihaknya belum bisa merinci dampak pada nilai tunjangan itu. Pemerintah daerah masih menunggu petunjuk dari Kementerian Pendayagunaan Aparatur Negara dan Reformasi Birokrasi (Kemenpan dan RB) soal perubahan pejabat struktural menjadi fungsional."Sekarang kan istilahnya miskin fungsional, tapi kaya struktural. Nanti berbalik jadi miskin struktural tapi kaya fungsional. Itulah yang diinginkan pemerintah pusat," kata Chaidir.

Thousands of Echelon III and IV Positions in DKI Threatened to be Erased
Nov 04 2019, 11:07 by Mosita Dwi Septiasputri


Thousands of Echelon III and IV Positions in DKI Threatened to be Erased

KBRN, Jakarta: President Joko Widodo's discourse to streamline the bureaucracy in the central government to the regions is predicted to have the impact of the removal of 5,340 echelon III and IV positions in the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government. the regional performance allowance (TKD) officials must be reviewed again. "Although there is a change in position from structural to functional, but they still receive performance allowances. But it still needs to be studied further," Chaidir said as reported by Antara on Monday (4 / 11/2019). At present the total number of officials who fill echelon III positions in DKI Jakarta reaches 862 people. While echelon IV reaches 4,478 people or a total of 5,340 echelon III and IV officials in DKI Jakarta. For echelon III consists of section heads, field heads and sub-district heads. While echelon IV consists of section heads, subdivision heads, sub division heads, heads of technical implementation units (UPT) and lurah. Chaidir explained, the influence of TKD is because structural downsizing in local governments will certainly have implications for the DKI Jakarta Regional Budget which is a source of financial support However, Chaidir explained, his party could not yet detail the impact on the value of the allowance. Local governments are still waiting for instructions from the Ministry of Administrative Reform and Bureaucracy Reform (Kemenpan and RB) about changing structural officials to functional. "Now the term is functionally poor, but rich in structural. Later it will turn into structural poor but functionally rich. That is what the central government wants "Chaidir said.
